It's so good to see them.

You were skipping along the edge of one of the towers and was precariously balanced upon the stones. Your heart skipped a beat when you were certain that you were going to fall, instead you learned Combat Reflexes.
I hope my guardian is pleased.

Your ward was skipping along the edge of one of the towers and was precariously balanced upon the stones. Your heart skipped a beat when you were certain that they were going to fall, instead they learned Combat Reflexes.
You have purchased a new discipline!
You have upgraded one of your disciplines.
You have purchased a new skill trait.
You have upgraded one of your skill traits.

You walk into the local medieval super center with a pocket full of gold. You are intending to spend every single last gold piece on new equipment, so you are properly outfitted for the battlefield. They have the latest in style and innovation for such a savey shopper as yourself.

You walk through Ye Olde Super Store to the melee weapons counter. The area is filled with training dummies, so you're able to practice with any weapon of your choice. You're in the mood to buy something that can really kill someone. Standing behind the counter is a young man lacking any muscles and wearing nothing but a loin cloth.
An arming sword is what I need.
The nice clerk behind the counter lays out three more weapons for you to look at..
I can reach out and touch someone with a polearm.
The nice clerk behind the counter lays out three more weapons for you to look at..
Erol Flynn used a rapier and main-gauche!
A saber makes a superb cut!
Just because it says short means it's not dangerous.
The nice clerk behind the counter lays out three more weapons for you to look at..
Maybe I should get a spear?
A staff made out of 100% Oak.
I like the heft of a battleaxe!
The nice clerk behind the counter lays out three more weapons for you to look at..
I know a two handed mace!
Head to the front of the store.

You make up your mind and head to the ranged weapon counter. Standing behind the counter is a short man with glasses that is surrounded by glass cases under lock and key. The department has several targets set up in order to let you try out the bows.
The English in me wants a long bow.
I don't need no special bow!
The short man with glasses presents you with his final selection.
A crossbow is what I need.
Head to the front of the store.

You decide that a shield is what you need to protect yourself from all the dangers on the field of battle. You walk into the department surrounded by shields of all shapes and sizes. A petite young woman, wearing a chain mail bikini, stands there looking at you apprehensively.
I am a true Knight! A knight's shield is what I need.
Show me more of your wares wench!
The woman walks you around to the other shields they sell.
A targe is just what this Scotsman needs!
A scutum my lady if you don't mind.
This aspis just speaks to me!
Head to the front of the store.

You walk to the armour department and see a strong, muscle bound man keeping watch over the area. Armour stands line the area to showcase all of the armour they have in stock. You casually look through their selection.
Cloth Armour is not only defensive but stylish!
Could you show me more wares?
You continue to browse the armour selection.
Halfplate would make a good investment!
Head to the front of the store.

A standard axe that is one handed and comes in a variety shapes.
Maces comprise anything from balls to morningstars.
An arming sword has a broad blade that is useable one handed.
Daggers come in a variety of shapes and sizes.
A standard lance for jousting and to attack the enemy with from horseback.
Polearms come in a variety of shapes and sizes.
The rapier and main-gauche became common as fencing took off.
a Saber's curved blade provides for better cutting ability at the loss of stabbing power.
A short sword is the standard sword for many armies and militias.
A spear comes in two flavors
column3: a long spear or a short spear.

column2: A typical staff is made from a hardwood like oak.
A battleaxe is the larger brother to the axe. It also comes in a variety of shapes and sizes.
The two handed mace is the larger brother to the mace and comes in a variety of shapes and sizes.
A longsword is a two handed sword that is capable of both slashing and thrusting into foes.
The horse bow is a staple of the Mongol and Turkish militaries.
The long bow provides better range and penetration over the standard bow.
The bow is the staple of many armies for their archers.
A crossbow takes less time to train troops to use, but the trade off is a longer reload time.
A knight's shield is a typical shield that utilizes two straps to hold it into place.
The round shield usually has a single strap and can be used offensively.
A buckler is the smallest shield available, but does allow the use of a dagger, combined with the shield, when fighting.
The targe is a shield found exclusively amongst the Scottish and other nearby cultures.
The scutum was the standard shield of the Roman Army.
The aspis was the standard shield of the Greek Armies.
Cloth Armour is the lightest of the armours due to being comprised of several dense layers of cloth.
Leather armour offers a substantial improvement over the cloth armours using hardened hide as a base material.
Mail armour supplanted leather as metal smiths were able to manufacture the armour using a variety of techniques.
Halfplate combines mail with armoured plates that cover the vital areas.
Fullplate uses little of the mail armour allowing the wearer to have maximum protection by using metal plates.
